intro: Minuartia pienina, commonly known as the Pienin rock-cress, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Minuartia pienina is a perennial species that is often used in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
